column4: Anyone know of a nice document that explains where synaptic package manager installs the files for programs on ubuntu?
I used it to install apache httpd, and would like to know where things ended up...
Would the ubuntu directory structure be identical to debian for installs like apache2 httpd?

You mean where it downloads packages to? It installs files in packages depending on the packages requirements. You can use synaptic itself and look at a packages properties and see what files it put on your machine and where it put them.
